measured_by: relative fixation (proportion of time spent fixating on each option)
justification: "The fixation measure of interest in this section is the proportion of time spent fixating on each of the options… We refer to this measure of visual fixation as relative fixation."

measured_by: absolute fixation time (total duration of fixations on reward feedback)
justification: "The fixation measure of interest in this section is the total time fixating on the reward feedback in each trial. We will refer to this measure as absolute fixation."

measured_by: variance of the posterior distribution (S) produced by the Kalman filter learning model
justification: "The Kalman filter is a Bayesian model that tracks the expected values of options, as well as the uncertainties in those expectations… At each point in time, the Kalman filter provides an estimate of the value of an option as a Normal distribution, whose mean reflects the expected value, and whose variance reflects estimation uncertainty."

measured_by: β parameter (uncertainty bonus weight) in the UCB choice rule
justification: "…the β parameter acts as a weight on uncertainty in the UCB choice rule… the strong evidence favouring the KFL-UCB model… indicates that the β parameter is reliably positive."
